problem:
didt = "(V-R*iL)/L"
Rk = 1.0 #kOhm R = 1000*Rk
Lu = 10 #uH L = 1e-6*Lu
V = 1.0 #V iLm = 0.9 #mA iL = iLm*1e-3
T = L/R f = 1/T
ips = (V-R*iL)/L ipsm = ips*1e-3
For the circuit shown below
write an algebraic expression for the rate of change of the inductor current in terms of \(V\), \(R\), \(L\), and \(i_L\).
\(\frac{d i_L}{d t}\) =
Let \(R = $Rk\)k\(\Omega\) and \(L = $Lu\mu\)H. If at some time \(t\) we have \(V(t) = $V\)V and \(i_L(t) = $iLm\)mA what is the rate of change of inductor current? Express your answer in Amperes/millisecond.
